instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
hello, 
all work fine until i close the screen, when i open it its black screen but the keyboard light and CapsLock on, and after few second its power off.
i was put the board in full working body(to check if its from one of the parts) but the same.
so its board issue.

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
Did you also change LIO board/flex?
Possible issue with SMC_LID signal.
Be sure to check with original Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
i was put just the board on different full body so yes, also good LIO.
i will check SMC_LID line.
also with just battery.

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: SMC_LID look good, also see that at the start up the apple logo appear just after 20sec(checked with external OS but the same)

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: the mac work I'm closing the screen ,open it and its dead...

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: What is the exact SMC_LID level after open the lid again?

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: 3.4v before 3.4v after

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: Did PRAM reset?

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: did PRAM still the same...

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: Check J8300 pins 14 & 18 voltage, after came back from sleep.

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
14. 2.4V before and after
18. 3.3v before and after

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: D7701 voltage (both pins)?

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
LCDBKLT_BOOST 7.5V (pulse) 
PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT 25V stable
after sleep they drain slowly to 0v

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: after 1-2min they both 7.5v but no screen, keyboard and Caps Lock working

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
You need to work with board alone on the desk.
Use a magnet to simulate close lid.
Check BKLT_EN/PWM.

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
i dont think it backlight problem, the apple logo light on the back is on when i wake it up, also you can see that the backlight is on.
i notice that sometimes after 20-40sec is turn on suddenly but not all the time.
can be BIOS problem?

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
" after sleep they drain slowly to 0v
---------------
after 1-2min they both 7.5v but no screen"
Backlight requires 25V on D7701 cathode...

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
at the first 15-20sec when i wake it up its 25v stable and i see that there is backlight, after that the backlight is off and its drains..
so if it was the backlight i was should see the picture a least at the first 15sec

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: Pins 14 & 18 of J8300 maintain voltage after these 15-20s?

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
YES.
just D7701 down from 25v to 7.5v until im pressing some key on keyboard.

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
If DP_INT_HPD remains high, the LCD is detected and PCH should maintain image and backlight enabled.

If you still get 7.5V at D7701, backlight is also enabled, but U7701 doesn't boost, for some reason.
Change U7701 and inspect its traces and surrounding components and solders.

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
not working, i think it something with the wakeup EN on the board..what is that line? :rolleyes:
because if i put something between the screen to the Magnets when i close the screen i see that the screen goes black but it wake up immediately when i open it again

threads.title: 820-00165 wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
Inspect J9500 for corrosion.
Clean it anyway and check the solders.
